page.title: 05Parish Magazine of Hanley's
page.content: About 530 copies of the magazine are prepared each month,usually of between 20-28 pages.305 of these magazines are for the two Hanley villages.In Hanley, the loose sheets and covers are stapled together,again by voluntary helpers,and taken to another volunteer who inserts the Bishop's newsletter and any loose notes (the magazine has proved a very useful free postal service on occasion) and then takes bundles to 14 distributors.These latter deliver the magazine all over the parish to nearly 300 homes;a few are sent by post to people who have moved away from the area.
